website_summaries.verdict: Powder supplement that helps clean teeth, gums, and improve your cat's breath.
pros: Contains only seaweed from the North Atlantic with no added preservatives, gluten, or sugar
Powder is designed to be sprinkled on your cat's wet or dry food
Helps reduce tartar and plaque and also improves bad breath
cons: Some cats don't like the taste and won't eat it

customer_reviews.title: Works so well!
customer_reviews.text: this took off the hard tarter off my chihuahuas teeth
customer_reviews.author: wolfreader

customer_reviews.title: I used on my 15 yr old cougar who I ...
customer_reviews.text: I used on my 15 yr old cougar who I suspect has a bacterial problem but is too old to sedate without trying all options. In less than 1 week his breath was much fresher and his drooling stopped. We continue to monitor him closely. He has no trouble eating and no signs of pain. I'm ordering more PlaqueOff. because he loves to be close and kiss!
customer_reviews.author: Lakota

customer_reviews.title: Very bad reaction to this product.
customer_reviews.text: Caution! I gave this to both of my Schnauzers yesterday and they were miserable shortly thereafter. They were both unwilling to move around and acted as if they were in pain. My male threw up several times during the night. My female still looks like she is in pain. This is going straight into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it's making a difference but more importantly ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it's making a difference but more importantly the bottle says do NOT give to dogs with hypothyroidism . This warning is not mentioned in the listing for this product .The warning on the bottle was also covered up with a sticker , so I gave it to my dog for 3 weeks before Realizing there was a warning label.
customer_reviews.author: amber keown

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! See my teeth says my dog...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have used this product for years! I brush their teeth daily too. My youngest dog, age five, has never had her teeth cleaned at the vets!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Van Duyn

customer_reviews.title: If you own a small breed don't buy this but it probably will be fine for the big ones 80lbs and up
customer_reviews.text: Not for small dogs. My yorkie became ill, hair loss, loss of weight, loss of control in back legs frequently causing her to fall. Last but not least, seizures. I don't know why it took me until the seizures to connect what was doing it but she is 13 and part of me thought it was just the end. I stopped giving it to her and she's healthy as a horse again. I hope the hair gets thicker. The stuff did clear her plaque though! But at what cost? If you own a small breed don't buy this but it probably will be fine for the big ones 80lbs and up.
customer_reviews.author: P. Borrone

customer_reviews.title: Shocked at how well it is working
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how it works, but it does. My Shih Tzu had/has plaque buildup on his front canines and a few in the back. I started using this about 25 days ago. Checked his teeth today and the teeth in the back are white again and one of the canines are white as well. I have one other canine tooth in the front which still has buildup - so it may take a bit longer to see striking results on that one. But I do see a difference on that tooth. How does a little "pepper-looking grit" on top of food clean teeth? Shocked.
customer_reviews.author: TravelGal

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on my cat after one full year of use
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on my cat every day for a full year and I waited to review it until that amount of time to give the most accurate review possible. I started using it immediately after a teeth cleaning. I just took him in for a yearly exam and he had heavy buildup of tartar on his teeth, so I'm not convinced that it helps with tartar buildup. However I think it did reduce the yellowing on his teeth. I just ordered a second bottle because I'm going to try it on my dog to see if it removes the yellow staining, but I'm not sure that it works for what it's advertised as which is "plaque off".
customer_reviews.author: Jillf

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION: CAT OWNERS.
customer_reviews.text: CAUTION TO CAT OWNERS. DO NOT USE UNTIL YOU HAVE CONSULTED WITH YOUR VET. I used this on my cat for about 3-4 days. He became aggressive and violent. After I stopped using it, he wen back to his normal self. I took him to the vet and told them about the plaque off. They said it is only proven to work for dogs. It has not been tested for cats. The information is inaccurate. So cat peers I recommend not to use this.
customer_reviews.author: keshbabi7

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works! I’m sold!
customer_reviews.text: I have a rescue dachshund that has always had HORRIBLE teeth. The proof is in the pictures. 6 weeks in and I am SOLD!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: Ok I had no idea what to expect on this one..read reviews, my dogs have awful plaque build up on their teeth and I didn’t want to spend $400 or put them under for a teeth cleaning. I just got this product on Monday, so literally have only been using it for less than a week—I took my scraper that I’d recently gotten (and had zero luck with), and the dark plaque came RIGHT OFF!!! What?! I though it at least would take a month to see any results!! I’m definitely buying more—!!!!
customer_reviews.author: A G

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I have an American Bulldog with the worst breath ever! Not sure why but his breath has always been bad. Taken him to the vet and no issues that they can find. I have noticed some tartar on his teeth, but nothing horrible. Started using this product and within 3 days there was a considerable difference! After a week even better. I did skip a day and noticed it seemed worse the next day. Hoping this lasts as there have been no side effects and now I don't hold my nose when he tries to give me a kiss!
customer_reviews.author: Laura I. Shultz

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING product!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING product!!!!!!! In just two days my dog's teeth, gums and breath had unbelievable improvement! I have a dachshund so they're prone to tooth problems and he started showing signs of mouth pain. He had bad gingivitis and tartar build up. Now, his mouth is so much better, he has no signs of mouth pain and he's so much better. The vet said yesterday that he has some slight tartar and that's after about four days of using this product! He's a candidate for non anesthetic dental tooth cleaning now and will be a healthy doggie who keeps all his teeth!
customer_reviews.author: JESSICA B

customer_reviews.title: Pearly whites!
customer_reviews.text: We've used this daily for two+ years since our dog was a puppy and her teeth still look new. Even the vet has commented on how nice and clean they look. Our dog seems to like the taste.
customer_reviews.author: T Sam

customer_reviews.title: Bye Bye Stinky Breath
customer_reviews.text: We had scheduled a tooth cleaning for our dachshund who has severe back issues and has had back surgery. We were afraid that the doctor might inadvertently twist his spine while he was under anesthesia and he'd be paralyzed again. (He can walk now but is wobbly.) A friend told us about PlaqueOff. I cancelled the cleaning and ordered the PlaqueOff. He no longer has horrible breath. Most dogs should have their teeth cleaned periodically but our boy is fragile and this product has really made a difference in our lives. No more bad breath. Yeah!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Don’t spend a fortune on getting your dogs teeth cleaned at the vet, try this first, it honestly works. You need to give it time and be consistent though, it’s not an overnight fix. My dog is getting older and I really didn’t want to spend a fortune on the whole process of putting him to sleep and getting his teeth cleaned so I have been looking for other options and fortunately came across this stuff. I usually add it to a spoon of peanut butter or on eggs and they don’t mind the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It took 6 months but it worked!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 17 year old cat with a heart condition who cannot be put under anesthesia. Per the recommendation of my vet, I tried this and added a little bit to her food everyday. After 2 months, I saw no difference and was, honestly, disheartened but I continued. After another month, I noticed her breath was a little better and I was able to flick off a tiny piece of tartar from a back tooth! After 6 months, a big chunk flaked off. I'll continue giving to her until I think enough of the tartar is gone. I was deeply skeptical that this would work but I'm very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jacoby

customer_reviews.title: It works! Just give it some time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I didn’t want to sedate our 10 year old dachshund to clean her teeth. At first I noticed plaque being gone from gum line and tip of teeth. With $4 dental tools from Amazon I was able to scrape off other plaque easily! Now I give it to her daily along with younger Doxie who at this point has no issues. TIP: to not lose spoon, cut off 2 “ piece of a straw, tape it to side of bottle, and spoon can sit inside straw
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M. Connolly

customer_reviews.title: It works! I'm honestly shocked!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product out of desperation. My 8-year old dog's teeth were incredibly high maintenance, requiring a full dental (including anesthesia) once or twice a year, and brushing and scraping heavy plaque deposits off her teeth every week. She's a 40lb dog, so she received 1 scoop with her morning meal and 1 with the afternoon meal. I began noticing small improvements within two weeks. By three months she didn't have any plaque remaining on her teeth. I haven't had to any other maintenance since I began using this product on my dog. The product doesn't smell to me. I'm truly astounded by how well this product worked and I've been recommending it to family every since.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Lane

customer_reviews.title: This stuff gets working right away
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on reviews posted at Chewy. My male cat has had rotten breath for so long I think it was making himself angry. Every yawn was like a sewer. He loves this stuff. He waits to have it sprinkled on his food. Within three days his breath Odor was knocked down to half, within a week, it was almost gone, the yellowing on his teeth has been reduced, and after two weeks boy-cat is sleeping next to me on the bed without being angry. This product is wonderful, and is saving me money not having to go to the pet dentist.
customer_reviews.author: SlinkyPuffs

customer_reviews.title: Not only remove some plague, but it killed my dog's bad breath.
customer_reviews.text: Wow... This stuff really works! In fact, I'm ordering more after I write this review. After consistently using it for a couple of months, I've seen a huge difference in my dog's teeth. I still need to get her teeth professionally cleaned, but the urgency to do it is not as much of a priority. Her breath was deadly! LOL But, since using PlaqueOff, her bad breath is completely gone! I'll make an appointment this month for the actually cleaning, but I will definitely use PlagueOff for maintenance. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable results. Really works!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Pomeranian with heart disease. She's 10 years old and vet said could not use anesthesia on her because of her CHF. Her teeth are rotten and had been bleeding because of an abcess. I bought this as a last resort. Didn't think it would work but I had to try something. Well I am still using it after 3 months. Her teeth were a lot whiter in about 2 weeks still getting better but if it worked on my dogs horrible teeth it will work on any dog. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: cATHY cARPENTER

customer_reviews.title: Truly a miracle in just 1week!
customer_reviews.text: Miracle after only 1 week! Plaque is almost 80% gone. I was about to pay $850 for my 2 Maltese to have their annual teeth cleaning under anesthesia. I saw this item and thought no harm in trying it. My babies had no problem eating their food with this sprinkled on top. They don’t like the taste of other plaque removers or chewables. I truly didn’t think this would work bc I’ve tried so many other plaque removers.
customer_reviews.author: SusannaF

customer_reviews.title: Our vet was amazed at the results!
customer_reviews.text: This product works so well! Our vet wanted us to have our dogs brought in and sedated for a dental cleaning. We decided to try this first, and the results were incredible. We gave them a scoop every day, and after about 2 weeks, the plaque could be scraped off. We gave them bones to chew on to help the plaque get chipped off. Our vet was amazed at the results and said their teeth looked great! We’re doing this product daily for 3 weeks at a time, every 3 or 4 months now. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Got 2 BIG chunks off his teeth!
customer_reviews.text: Just adopted a 12 yo beagle with TERRIBLE tartar on his teeth, and kidney problems (probably from his bad teeth). Bought this on a whim hoping it might help. Well the jar is half gone and I was able to pick off with my fingernail 2 BIG chunks of tartar off his back teeth. I mean it was thick and covered his whole tooth! His kidneys are improving, and the Vet says he can get his teeth cleaned now. I think I will continue to use this after his cleaning to keep plaque at bay.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Just wasn't helpful for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I was very hopeful this product would have been an ideal complement to my less than successful attempts at brushing my dogs teeth (they really don't like it, probably because of pain associated with plaque buildup). Unfortunately, this didn't seem to help. I used this for 2 months with the recommended daily serving, and I did not notice any distinguishable improvement to either dog's teeth, gums, or breath (and both love to kiss!) I'm left wondering if it's because they didn't salivate enough regularly for the product to impact their teeth. I didn't want to spend on a third bottle without knowing there would be any improvement, so I'm now trying another product (health mouth).
customer_reviews.author: Junior

customer_reviews.title: The only product to work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this powder for both of my 10 year old dogs and they have terrible tartar build up. It is the only thing that has worked. I have been able to brush chunks of tartar away. I have tried everything else. The vet would not sedate them for cleanings due to their age and this is literally the ONLY product that has worked! I honestly cant believe it! I would recommend to any pet owner!
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: Unsure but hopeful
customer_reviews.text: My dog was a little skeptical but is eating it like it's not there anymore. The improvement of her bad breath is moderate but anything is better than nothing! We are on our second bottle right now. I think the improvement that I would suggest is the scoop. I am glad that my fingers are small so I can reach the short little handle of the scoop whereas my boyfriend can't get his fingers in that little bottle. When I received my first bottle I was shocked at how little the bottle was and how tiny the scoop was! Pictures led me to believe otherwise so I had a good laugh!
customer_reviews.author: B. Crocker

customer_reviews.title: It worked for dog. Patience is needed.
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I took before and after pictures because the difference is crazy. My dog had thick yellow and brown plaque on his teeth and now his teeth are whiter than mine! I have a 10lb toy poodle and it took about 4-6 weeks for me to finally see improvement. I would coat small pieces of cucumber in the recommend dose of powder and mix that into his dry food. It works but you just have be patient because it doesn't seem to slowly come off, the plaque kind of falls off all at once.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this about a month on my 3 three old dog and while he didn't really have a a lot of plaque, I could see that it was starting. This seems to have stopped additional plaque and the few areas he had is starting to just "chip off". Only draw back is, no matter how well you mix in dry food, some ends up uneaten in the bowl......
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. W

customer_reviews.title: It works Great...
customer_reviews.text: One of our little rescues is a breed that is known for bad teeth... She had her teeth cleaned about 8 months ago and they pulled 2 teeth... She has a tiny mouth and tiny teeth and brushing them is near impossible, although we try... We use the plaque off a few times a week in her food (no problem with her eating it--she likes it and it has not upset her stomach).. I check her teeth pretty regularly and they are pearly white and her breath is fine... We still brush her teeth occasionally but the plaque off takes care of the problem..
customer_reviews.author: two rescue dogs

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for this ingenious solution
customer_reviews.text: My senior dog is in liver failure so vets will not put her under for a dental cleaning. Her breath was very very very bad and smelled like death. I felt bad for her imagining having to live with her mouth and tasting that terrible smell all the time. So being eager to try anything for her, this seaweed was a last resort and it drastically reduced the odor in a little under 2 weeks of one serving daily. Although, she won’t let me examine her mouth closely to see her teeth condition, it’s obvious the seaweed has helped greatly and it’s unfortunate the vets are not more aware of simple solutions like this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pilcher

customer_reviews.title: Plaque off seems to really work!
customer_reviews.text: Well I bought this for plaque and doggy breath and it’s working well for those issues. An added bonus is that is seems to clearing up tear stain on our Japanese Spitz, woohoo!! It’s something we’ve struggled with and this seems to really helping with that issue. Haven’t done anything different, other than adding Plaqueoff, so I’m assuming it has to be this.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B.

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: I was gonna take my dog to the vet to have his teeth cleaned BUT This stuff really works broke down big pieces of plaque. My dog does not notice it in his food.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: PlaqueOff and L-Lysine Is helping my two cats with Stomatitis!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats with Stomatitis. One got antibiotics and a steroid shot and the other didn't (19 and Feral!). I read that PlaqueOff and L-Lysine are good for Stomatitis, so started adding both to their food. It's been over 5 months now and they are both doing good without pulling teeth. The older one at 19, whose condition is the worst, can eat again and isn't experiencing the painful episodes he was having. The younger one at 2, shows no more symptoms. I have six cats, so they all get the supplements and with this product, I have noticed a reduction in plaque in all of them.
customer_reviews.author: HoustonLisa

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I out this in my dogs food every morning, and she does not notice any difference. I was afraid she might reject her food with it in there. The plaque on her teeth look better, but I have only been using it less than a month. I am hoping this will loosen up more plaque , so I can scrape it off. I don't want to pay the vet. the exhorbitant fees to clean her teeth. and I don't like the idea of putting her under, I put tape on the outside of the bottle, to hold the teeny tiny scoop. That way it is easier to find. I think it is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Tashy

customer_reviews.title: I was hopeful but greatly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was really hopeful for this product after reading about it. I’ve been giving it to my dogs (jack russels) for a couple of months now. My one dog seems to build up plaque pretty quick in between cleanings. They seems to enjoy the taste of the product making it easy to ingest. Unfortunately I have not seen any difference in their teeth. I would not recommend this product. In the end there is no substitute for regular brushing and professional cleanings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING, EPIC THANK YOU PLAQUE OFF!❤
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! So my cat got sick and was having gum issues. We went to the vet three different times for infections of his gums. I now have a healthy cat and was able to pick off the tartar build up and have had zero issues since. I have four cats and they all have been taking this mixed in with their wet food. I use two cans of food and two leveled scoops of plaque off which is the proper amount for four cats. This product is just life saving and money saving, i will not need to take four cats to get their teeth cleaned that costs and arm and a leg.
customer_reviews.author: Gia monty

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money and put the $20 toward a vet ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave 2 scoops per day to my 30 pound dog (the amount for 40 lbs) every day. There was absolutely no change in her tarter or build up after using the entire container. Her build up was mild but she's elderly and I'd hoped to skip having to knock her out for a teeth cleaning at her age. The powder did nothing. Don't waste your money and put the $20 toward a vet visit.
customer_reviews.author: Wandering Vargr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed at how effective this product is at loosening up plaque on dog's teeth. After using it for a few days, plaque on my dog's teeth became brittle and easy to remove with a dental scale. This product is great, especially because it is a natural product. It also seems that my dog enjoys the taste. Fantastic product Proden! Using this product would probably be beneficial for most dogs and could save a dental visit. These results were achieved using PlaqueOff combined with daily brushing with an ozonated oil called 'Pur03 tooth and gum support':
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Not Working
customer_reviews.text: The product does not seem to work very well for my dogs. However, one of my dogs has pretty bad plaque so that might be part of it for her. I have not seen any difference in my other dog's teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Travel Gal

customer_reviews.title: Gave to a friend who says it works!
customer_reviews.text: I caved and had my dogs teeth cleaned this year so gave the bottle to a friend who was complaining about bad dog breath from her beloved pug. I recently checked in with her to see how it worked for future reference and she said great. No bad breath anymore. Her dog is very fussy about food but she was easily able to add it to some of her dog's favorites. She says also that she believe the tarter on her dogs teeth is better but she hasn't been trying it very long. With that recommendation I believe it's worth trying.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy M.

customer_reviews.title: It really worked!
customer_reviews.text: My chihuahua mix is a 12 years old and she was having a lot of build up and yellowing of her teeth. I wanted to save some money on a teeth cleaning from the vet so I tried this product. I am so glad I did because it has cleaned up her teeth so well and her bad breath is basically gone! All within the 1 month I have used it, I am going to reorder this product again because it worked so well.
customer_reviews.author: Sim

customer_reviews.title: Did not work gave one dog blood in his stool
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for over 6 mos on 2 Chihuahuas. One had no reaction but also not helping teeth. The other had bloody stools when on this product. I quit giving it to him 3 diff times thinking some other problem made the blood in the stool but as soon as he ate it more blood. So it obviously did nothing for his teeth either.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: No More Death Breath!!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product 1000 stars I would. My dog Mimis had terrible plaque buildup on her teeth. We would brush them and it did absolutely nothing. I have been using this product now for about 3 weeks and the plaque is just falling off with gentle brushing!!!! No more death breath!!! For ease I have just added it to her kibbles container and mixed it all up so there’s no chance of her missing it. A little has gone such a long way! Thank you so much for selling this wonderful product! I will definitely repurchase it to keep her teeth nice and healthy!
customer_reviews.author: katrina turner

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! Seeing improvement in less than 30 days!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old border collie. She gets two scoops in her morning dog food. I was a little worried about reactions as others claimed so I started her on half a scoop and increased slowly over a couple weeks to two scoops. I have had no issues with it. There is definitely not as much tarter in her teeth. Her breath is improving too. I didn't take a before picture and I wish I would have. But I am doing this and brushing her teeth just once a week and have already seen a big difference within a month of using it.
customer_reviews.author: H. RIvera

customer_reviews.title: No effect
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 pugs. They are finished up a second bottle. I give them a scoop once a day. We had been on this for 3 months. No changes in their breath. Still smells bad. Once I was done with this, I gave then raw bones after their raw dinner. The bones has helped more than this product. I wished this product would have worked.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Byers

customer_reviews.title: My dog hates it
customer_reviews.text: It's not that I hate it - my dog hates it. When I first started putting this stuff on her food she seemed to enjoy eating more (my dog is finicky). But after three days she began salivating a lot and then would not touch her food. I had to stop using it. Too bad-I wish it had worked for her.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L. Condelli

customer_reviews.title: Horrible... to good to be true
customer_reviews.text: This stuff made my chihuahua choke really badly so I couldn’t continue use and the manufacturer did not respond for me to be able to submit a return! I was really excited about using this but I added it to my dogs food and she instantly started coughing and choking. It’s unfortunate the sellers don’t reply
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Made two dogs incredibly ill
customer_reviews.text: This product made both my dogs incredibly ill, 1 is a toy poodle she immediately became lethargic could not even walk around the block & my miniature pinscher-normally an ultra-hyper dog became listless...I started & stopped the product twice to make sure it was the reason for the change in behavior, once I stopped feeding it to them they resumed their normal cheerful selves, Thankfully! Natural or not we must be incredibly careful regarding the health of our furry babies.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon B

customer_reviews.title: If it works, it is worth a fortune!
customer_reviews.text: It is too early to know if this is going to be a worthwhile endeavor. I bought it on my sister's recommendation. Her dog will absolutely not allow any dental care, so she has now give it to her Yorkie for the better part of a year, and he is showing much improvement in his teeth. I am now using it on my 12 year old cat who has never had any dental work and just started my doggie on it after her teeth were cleaned by the vet. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: MountainWoman

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: Our 5 year old dog started to bleed when she played tug a war, so I ordered this and started being more consistent with brushing her teeth/ giving her an edible toothbrush. Her gums are healthier and her teeth are white. There's still one small patch of tartar but the rest has fallen off. The scoop is tiny so the bottle lasts for a long time. She eats this just fine with her food (of course she loves food so don't know if that's saying much). I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: book nerd

customer_reviews.title: It helped in other ways too....
customer_reviews.text: Product worked far better than I thought it would. I have a boxer mix and a pit mix. My pit mix had the worst breath and her teeth were terrible. I have only used this 3 days and I already see an huge improvement. Her bad breath is gone and her teeth ard cleaner. Not only that but she seems more playful and happy. I haven't seen her play like this in a year and she is only 2 1/2 years old. She is leaping in the air again which she hasn't done in a long time. She has so much more energy. I will be ordering this again. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ericka M.

customer_reviews.title: Dogs hate it, won't eat their food with this on it.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money since my dogs hate the taste. Tried just a small amount even though the dose is a pretty big amount to mix with their food. They would come close to food bowl and snarl and run away when they just got close. They hated even the smell of it. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Mary D

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff! After two weeks, I noticed my dog’s teeth are whiter! She’s 5 years old and the plaque buildup was significant ending to raise concern. I’d say the plaque is reduced by 60-75%. There’s still some on her larger teeth, but the majority of her mouth looks cleaner than it has in a few years! She’s a large breed so she gets two scoops every dinner. I can’t speak for the taste, but she doesn’t seem to notice it at all. I’ve already recommended it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Finally one that works for my dog.
customer_reviews.text: My male Border Collie had a real problem with tarter and bad breath. Vet visits where getting expensive so I tried many products to combat the problem. Some made the dog sick, others did nothing to improve the situation. I was talking to a friend and he recommended this product and said it worked well with his dog, so I gave it a try. So far it seems to be working well and it's easy to use with no ill side affects. I guess all dogs are different but you might want to give this a try if other products have not worked for you... j
customer_reviews.author: LowJack

customer_reviews.title: This product really works!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is truly amazing! I had read many of the reviews saying that plaque on your dogs teeth would just fall right off. Although I haven’t seen that, my dogs’ breath is so much better! You take a tiny little scoop and put it in their food in the morning, give them a chew toy and it definitely keeps the plaque off. Our little dogs don’t like to have their teeth brushed and their teeth are now gleaming white! I referred my friends to this product as well and they all love it! Would highly highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle P.

customer_reviews.title: Dog had allergic reaction
customer_reviews.text: My dog had a negative reaction to this product. Following a few days of use, intense scratching and biting of skin occurred. Veterinarian suspected allergic reaction to ingredients. After stopping product, the itching and scratching stopped. Will have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: NJE

customer_reviews.title: Just started using this product for our 6 cats
customer_reviews.text: even though it smells horrible to me-- my cats seem to love it mixed in just a tiny bit of wet food. All of my 6 cats eat dry food but we started making it a morning routine to help all their teeth. So far so good- they all gobble up their food and don't leave a bit on their plates. Have Cats ranging from 3 years to 10 and they are all in need of some dental products. Everyone is very happy with this routine. And I just ordered the larger 180 GM size. Will continue to use - LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog will not eat
customer_reviews.text: My dog will not even touch her food.. so I can only say it must not taste good.. feed her without and she chow downs.. She is 16lbs and can't afford to lose weight or not eat.. I was hopeful as she has minor tarter was hoping it would at least keep it to a workable condition .. waste of 16$
customer_reviews.author: Judy N.

customer_reviews.title: Good product but...
customer_reviews.text: I have been relying on this product for years to help keep my pets' teeth clean. It seems to help quite a bit. However the last bottle I received appears to be defective, or they changed the formula. In the past it has always been green crystals. This is a very fine powder with irregular bits in it. I'm going to try to contact the manufacturer and find out if I need to return this bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Jenelle L. Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I have a rescued Dachshund not sure what his age is but his teeth and breathe were horrible. I tried this product until the bottle was empty and I'm satisfied with the results. An extra step to help chip the plaque is to give raw frozen bones. The thickness of the plaque has decreased significantly.
customer_reviews.author: DAI

customer_reviews.title: Stomach issues
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 8.6 lbs and was not letting me brush his teeth due to some loose teeth so I bought this hoping to slow down or stop any plaque build up. It was fine for the first two weeks I mixed it with his food but after that my dog started with uncrontrollable diarrhea. Since that was the only new thing he had in his diet I eliminated it to see if that was the cause and sure enough after about 3 days off this he was fine. Having said that my dog does have a delicate stomach and doesn’t do well with store bought dog food or meds.
customer_reviews.author: judith l.manganelli

customer_reviews.title: But unfortunately bad breath is just better some days than others
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was really working the first week. I add to both morning and evening food for 2 months now. But unfortunately bad breath is just better some days than others. It has helped the old girls breath, doesn't knock you over from across the room just if within 3 feet. She's too old for more teeth extractions or cleanings. So we'll keep using this product and the tarter control added to her water, along with breath chews. PS this product stains her white ceramic food bowl, washing daily just doesn't do it. I have to rinse it with bleach water every few days.
customer_reviews.author: Tally Talbotts

customer_reviews.title: dog got sick
customer_reviews.text: The bottle I got wasn't sealed. The powder got on the lip and never got a good seal. I figured that nobody tampered with it to kill so I used it. My dog got sick before morning. Not using it again. Threw the rest out. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not use on dogs with GI, thyroid, or liver issues!
customer_reviews.text: I can only give this 3 stars at the moment. I’ve not used it long enough to see if it actually works or not, but after 1 dose (1/4 tiny scoop), my 11# dog had a severe IBD/Colitis episode within 12 hours. He does have IBD/Colitis & liver issues, so reacts badly to anything that may cause an increase (or dumping) of bile or digestive enzymes, which may be the reason he reacted to it. My other dog (25#, healthy with only a chicken allergy) has had no bad reactions to this product, so I’ll continue giving it to her.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great plaque remover
customer_reviews.text: Best product for removing plaque from teeth. Quite remarkable how Well It works. First purchasede it in a pet store in The UK and it states the product is made From a seaweed of sorts. The USA version just says proprietary formula. It is I believe all natural And not chemical. Only drawback is it doesn’t get rid of bad breath but the teeth are nice and white now.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Wang

customer_reviews.title: Super effective but....
customer_reviews.text: This product does what it says. I really helped with my dog's teeth. However, she was SUPER DUPER DUPER allergic to it and had crazy itching and darkening of the skin from all the licking and scratching. I feel so bad because I didn't connect the dots fast enough to relieve her discomfort. Now that I've stopped using the ProDen, she is much better allergy-wise, but her skin is permanently darkened.
customer_reviews.author: a.t.

customer_reviews.title: If your cat has stomatitis
customer_reviews.text: Giving to cat who has stomatitis and vet wanted to extract most of his teeth to the tune of $2,500! Thought I would try this, what did I have to lose. His mouth is less inflamed and he's back to eating hard food again. Trying it on my dog now, an older miniature poodle with dragon breath.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Payne

customer_reviews.title: ... has some plaque build up and beginning to have bad breath and I saw reduced plaque and pleasing results ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9 year old yorkie who has some plaque build up and beginning to have bad breath and I saw reduced plaque and pleasing results after a few weeks of using this. I also have a 12 year old Yorkie whose teeth and breath are terrible; we used to get his teeth cleaned every year until a couple years ago-it was just too much for him as he got older; I might have noticed a very slight help with this product, but he also had to go on antibiotics for the infection in his mouth. I would continue using and recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Higgs

customer_reviews.title: Removed thick, hard plaque buildup!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was sooo skeptical of this stuff despite the great reviews.. but I’m so glad I bought it!! I have a 7 year old silky terrier with AWFUL teeth and disgusting breath. We got his teeth professionally cleaned a year and a half ago but the plaque built up again immediately after. We can’t keep affording the high cost and I get nervous having to put him under. I started adding this powder to his food FOUR DAYS AGO and was able to easily scrape the hardened thick plaque buildup off of his canines. This is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Emily Cawley

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to help my dog with her plaque problem. Followed the directions for use, and it made my dog sick. Reduced the amount, same results. Talked with my veterinarian and he advised to stop. This product does not work and is a waste of money. I can’t get my money back because its been opened, so save your money. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: i am seeing results
customer_reviews.text: vet appointment = dogs have tartar , gingivitis. really don't want to put them through dental cleaning and knocking them out. so I started to brush and use this. I am starting to see great results from this. since I now brush on a regular basis I do see that the tartar has diminished so I will continue to purchase this and check out the next vet visit. will follow up after next dental visit in September but the pups don't seem to mind this added to their food and I am sure this is helping tartar
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Mady my dog so sick
customer_reviews.text: This gave my dog terrible diarrhea and vomiting. I gave her just a teeny, tiny spoonful of this, using the included scooper per the directions. After the first or second time of giving her this, she got really bad diarrhea and puked quite a lot twice. As soon as I stopped giving her this, she was much better. I know that stuff like this has different effects on each dog, but I don't recommend it based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: chicagoan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!
customer_reviews.text: I tried everything to clean the plaque off our young dog's teeth. At only 2, I had tried all sorts of doggie toothpaste, brushes and dental cleaning options. He hated all of them and they just don't work. Despite the brushing and all the chewy bones and toys he constantly chews up, the plaque was creeping all over his teeth. The vet just shrugged her shoulders, but I knew we were headed for expensive dental treatments in our future. Then we found this miracle item. I can't recommend it highly enough. I already see a difference a few weeks later. IT WORKS! The plaque is nearly gone.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought if for my 4 yo small dog because her breath is fishy. I started giving her 1/2 scoop but didn't see anything different over a week so i started giving her the full scoop and after 2 days with diarrhea started to keep it down with no problem, but, is almost gone and she hasn't had any changes on her breath. I also started giving it to my puppy and she is now with bad breath! not recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Damian Rivas

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: My vet has been trying to get me to get my pugs teeth cleaned for awhile. I did not feel comfortable putting him under anesthesia so I opted to do some research to see if there was another way to remove the tartar from my dogs teeth. I came across this product and read reviews. I saw quite a few people saying after a few weeks, the tartar was chipping off. My first thought was no way, but decided to give it a whirl. My dog has been on this for 3 weeks and most of the caked on tartar has completely come off his teeth. His teeth are white again. THIS PRODUCT IS AMAZING!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JESS

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous health hazard
customer_reviews.text: This product made my dog get an upset stomach. He threw up a few times before I was able to realize this product was the cause.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin

customer_reviews.title: I put the recommended scoops in their dry dog food
customer_reviews.text: After about two weeks of use I started to notice a huge difference in both my dogs teeth. I put the recommended scoops in their dry dog food, which they didnt seem to mind. I brushed their teeth atleast twice a week and then bought a dental dog plaque scraper and scraped their teeth for the first time and the plaque literally cracked off!!! I was truly amazed, ive been brushing their teeth and it didnt seem to do anything for the exisiting plaque and horrible breath....two weeks with this product and a plaque scraper I was able to clean both their teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Ariana Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Made my dogs sick
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my senior dogs who needed improved dental hygiene but it gave them stomach upset, so I stopped giving it to them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Cats won't go near it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on the recommendation of a pet care company employee. I tried putting the tiniest bit in my cat's food and it sat untouched for a full day. They finally ate it because they were so hungry, and then threw up all over the house. I cannot use this product and have wasted money, since I can't return it now that it's opened. Also it smells horrible. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Quick results.
customer_reviews.text: My two little dogs 20 & 10 lbs have been using this for 11 days. I only use half the recommeded amount, mixed in their breakfast. Their teeth ar noticeably whiter and today I scapped their teeth and all the plaque was easily coming off their teeth. If you had any concerns I assume you could use this product in cycles. (Use for a couple weeks, clean teeth, wait a month or two...repeat)
customer_reviews.author: Little_Pupper

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems to enjoy it. I think it helps add flavor to his food. He doesn’t love kibbles so I tend to add a little extra of something on top to get him to eat it and this is one of the toppers he enjoy. Which makes it even better being that he’s getting a teeth cleaning while enjoying it. He has gotten his teeth professionally cleaned but between using this and some other cleaning supplies his teeth have remained white. This one bottle has lasted me since January.
customer_reviews.author: BessieLB

customer_reviews.title: Does not agree with my dog
customer_reviews.text: On two different occasions I put this on my elderly dog's breakfast. She was slow to eat it and later in the day had diarrhea. So, I will not be offering it to her again. Too bad I can't return it or pass it on to someone else to try. Conceptually, it is an interesting idea, but a fail for us.
customer_reviews.author: a human

customer_reviews.title: Not good for sensitive stomachs
customer_reviews.text: I did see an improvement in my dogs teeth after using this product for a week; however one of my dogs did have a few episodes of vomiting that were due to this powder so I had to discontinue use. I think that if your pet doesn’t have a sensitive stomach this would work well. Unfortunately it didn’t work for our family.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Really Saw Little Improvement
customer_reviews.text: I used this diligently for several weeks on both my dogs. Did not see any real improvement with teeth looking better. I think it helped to keep teeth from becoming more built up with tartar and plaque. I'm currently cleaning their teeth with a gel bought at Walmart and have a dental tool recommended on Amazon that I use on them a little bit at a time to hopefully keep them from needing a cleaning at the Vet. This Plaqueoff product didn't do enough for my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This Product Really Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: I just paid almost $300 for a dental cleaning on one of my Beagles who had stage 4 periodontal disease, but I have been using this product on my other Beagle for about 4 days and all of her plaque and tartar have disappeared. I wish I had taken a Before and After photo to show. I sprinkle 1 scoop on their dry dog food once a day. It's amazing how fast it works. I will be using this for preventative cleaning moving forward. So much easier than trying to brush their teeth!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie S.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Good seller. Arrived on time and in good condition. I have been buying this product for two full years and using it daily for two of my dogs. I wanted a natural teeth cleaner, because my dogs will not let me brush their teeth. Period. I have concerns about yearly anesthesia for vet dental cleanings. It can't be good for my older dogs. This product does nothing that I can see in cleaning up dental plaque. My dogs teeth are brown and I will need to take them for a dental cleaning. I'm very disappointed. I really wanted a safe, natural product to help with their dental hygiene.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my small dog
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this consistently for over 2 months with no difference whatsoever. I can't seem to figure out why. I've used the correct dosage, but plaque continues to build on my small dog's teeth. Disappointing as it seems to work well for other customers. I'm tempted to give up and stop using completely, seeing as smaller dogs have received side effects. It makes me nervous that I could potentially be giving something harmful to my dog just hoping it would do it's job.
customer_reviews.author: crankycarrot

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of dismal results after veterinary visits for my cat, and several lost teeth resulting from chronic dental issues, after 6 months of using this product, when my cat went into the vet for her exam (and the anticipated dental cleaning and more lost teeth), our vet told us that our cat's teeth looked wonderful! No cleaning was needed. In fact, the vet asked for the information about this product so she could recommend it to other pet owners with pets with similar issues. A definite life saver.
customer_reviews.author: dc7462

customer_reviews.title: Okay product
customer_reviews.text: I do believe this product helps, but it’s not a miracle product. I have 4 dogs I use this on. One it seemed to work really well (10 year old) on, the youngest one is 2 and has great teeth as it is. I use it as a preventative for her. My older 2 are 12 years old and it doesn’t seem to do too much for them. I will continue to use it though along with brushing and dental cleanings at my vets recommendation as I did have some results with the one dog.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It does work!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has some starting plaque at her back teeth even though I am brushing almost daily her teeth. I got this product since a lot of reviews with pictures showed the before and after. It does work BUT, I started seeing results when the bottle was almost empty. I was giving it twice a day with my dogs meal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical...
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about PlaqueOff. I searched the product every where and the reviews were all great so I bought the smallest bottle to try and I will be buying more! After a week and a half of use, my dog's breath DRASTICALLY improved! His breath was slightly gag worthy but at his age, I didn't want to take him in to be put under to get his teeth cleaned. After a full two weeks, I've noticed his teeth looking cleaner and his gums do not look as red as before. I highly recommend people trying this product out to see if it helps their pet!
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my 9yo dog, his teeth and gums are much happier
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how some seaweed cleans my dogs teeth, but I really think they do look better after a few weeks using this. I give him a tiny little scoop a day (comes with the bottle) because he is only 20lbs, and he has done quite well with it. He has no food issues, so he doesn't turn up his nose at the addition to his food, and within a few weeks, I really do see healthier gums, cleaner teeth and whiter teeth, amazing. What can it hurt? Unless of course, your dog has thyroid issues, then don't give them this item. But if they are otherwise healthy, give it a go.
customer_reviews.author: Overlandtraveler

customer_reviews.title: It definitely helps
customer_reviews.text: It didn't consistently clean her teeth as well as promised. When I first purchased the product I was amazed at how well it worked, now that we've used it awhile it's almost like her body adjusted to it and I'm seeing gunk in her teeth again. However, in the grand scheme of things there has so far still been an overall huge improvement compared to not using it.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a last resort before sending both my dogs (Pomeranian and Miniature Poodle) to the vet for very expensive cleanings. Despite giving them dental treats daily and using dental wipes weekly, their teeth were covered in hardened tartar. I started giving them PlaqueOff about a 5 weeks ago , and in just 3 weeks the armor-like plaque loosened. I used my fingernails under their usual dental wipes to lightly scrape their teeth and huge chunks of tartar just peeled off their back teeth! It was amazing! At only 5 weeks of use, their teeth have visibly improved, and their breath is no longer the stuff of nightmares. I highly recommend trying out this product!
customer_reviews.author: Pamella

customer_reviews.title: Didn't seem to help at all.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has great reviews so I decided to try it. My cat had terrible plaque and terrible odor because of it. Brushing was always near to impossible because, well, he's a cat, so I was hoping this would slow the need for brushing. His teeth were actually worse than before! I think it was that I had to mix it with wet food, to get it down him. I really wanted this to work, but it didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: had pretty bad breath and was in need of a dental
customer_reviews.text: My little 8 year old mixed breed, Harley, had pretty bad breath and was in need of a dental, that I couldn't afford. After some research I decided to give this a shot. I love this product! Harley's breath greatly improved after only one week or so! THe tartar on his teeth started to soften up and break up on their own! With the help of a scraper or a good chew toy it breaks off even further. At this rate I won't need to spend hundreds on a dental, or worry about how Harley will handle the anesthesia (with his history of seizures). Thanks for the alternative!
customer_reviews.author: Cortney

customer_reviews.title: My fur babies love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my little yorkie. He has terrible teeth ( what’s left) and breath! This product is great! It takes away the bad breath but I haven’t been using it but a few weeks and don’t know how long it takes to soften the plaque and tartar enough to get it off his teeth. But it is all natural ingredients and it’s worth trying it on your fur baby!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth McCoy

customer_reviews.title: not sure of long-term health effects
customer_reviews.text: I contacted the maker of the product, asking for more information as to research, long-term effects, testing, etc., and never got a response. Makes me wonder if they're covering anything up. Product seems to be working, yet I worry.
customer_reviews.author: Redgecko

product_meta.title: Proden PlaqueOff Dental Care for Dogs and Cats, 60gm
product_meta.description: Proden plaqueoff animal is an easy way for those dog and cat owners to care for their pet's teeth who don't have the patience or inclination to brush their dog or cat's teeth regularly. The product comes in powdered form and it is simply added on a daily basis to dry or wet food. Dogs and cats like the taste of the small amount that is added. Proden plaqueoff animal does not rely on topical application or friction. The product is ingested and works systemically. The natural compound in the product comes out through the saliva and works to break down the bacterial biofilm that forms on the teeth and gums. This is how the natural bacteria in the mouth take hold onto the teeth and gums, colonizing and creating the oral problems of plaque and tartar, bad breathe and gingivitis. It does not change the ph of the mouth or kill off the normal levels of bacteria. Proden plaqueoff has been proven to reduce plaque and tartar on the teeth and gums, depending on composition, diet and how long it has been there. It then works to prevent bad breath, plaque and tartar from returning. Patients generally begin to see results over a 2-8 week period, and will see further benefits with continued use. Proden plaqueoff animal is made from a specific strain of selected seaweed harvested from above scandinavia. This seaweed has developed a natural defensive mechanism against bacterial biofilm. The product is made only from this seaweed and has no additives or chemicals added. It is human grade and human tested.
feature_bullets: 100-percent natural oral supplement for dogs and cats
Generally sees results over a 2 to 8 week period
Made from a specific strain of seaweed harvested from above scandinavia
Promotes healthy teeth, gums and fresh breath

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
